Description.val:
Modernized LSD 41/49 Class ships transport and launch amphibious craft and vehicles with their crews and embarked personnel in amphibious assault operations. Supporting amphibious operations include landings via Landing Craft, Air Cushion (LCAC), conventional landing craft, and helicopters, onto hostile shores.

[P40A / ST003 LSD Hull, Mechanical and Electrical Condition System]: The LSD Hull, Mechanical and Electrical (HM&E) Condition System implements HM&E principles and would implement a Defense-in-Depth Functional Implementation Architecture (DFIA) and meet the requirements of the standards released by the Information Assurance Technical Authority Board (IA TAB) across all the HM&E systems deploying the ability to protect, detect, react, and restore in a contested environment.  The HM&E Condition System will monitor the signals on the HM&E network, both between HM&E systems and also those coming from other functional domains.

[P40A / ST002 - Propeller Blades & PLMU]: This SHIPALT replaces the existing Propeller Blades with higher efficiency blades and installs Propulsion Load Management Units (PLMU) that result in fuel savings and engine maintenance reduction as well as operational
benefits. Only 9 LSDs will require this SHIPALT as part of the Midlife Program.

[P40A / ST002 - Generators & Elect Distribution]: This SHIPALT replaces the generator on the Ship Service Diesel Generators (SSDG) with a higher wattage version and increased electric distribution capability for shore power, switchboard and load centers. This SHIPALT provides significant Return on Investment (ROI) through improved reliability and maintainability of electrical ship systems/equipment versus the obsolete and maintenance intensive equipment. Also, additional electrical plant loads will improve efficient operation of the currently under-loaded SSDGs and contribute to the ROI through reduced maintenance costs for the SSDGs.

[P40A / ST002 - Low Pressure Air Compressor]: This Ship Change replaces the Low-Pressure Air Compressors (LPAC) with modern, oil-free compressors. Parts obsolescence is a rapidly growing and more costly problem on these maintenance intensive compressors. This Ship Change provides Return On Investment (ROI) through improved reliability and maintainability of LPACs and reduced maintenance by elimination of oil contamination of pneumatic controls components (new compressors are oil free). In addition, the new compressors will provide significant readiness improvement through increased reliability of Vital, low-pressure air supply to Vital combat systems and the main propulsion controls.

[P40A / ST002 - Steering Control System]: This SHIPALT replaces the analog Helm and Lee Helm Steering Consoles and equipment with an electronic, computerized Steering Control System (SCS) that integrates various navigation parameters, such as location (latitude, longitude) from GPS as well as pitch, roll, speed, heading, and wind. SCS will be designed to integrate with Electronic Chart Display and Information Systems-Navy (ECDIS-N) digital nautical charts. The existing Bridge control system was designed in the late 1970s and is near the end of its useful service life. Parts obsolescence is a rapidly growing and costlier problem on this maintenance intensive control system. The IBS also provides significantly enhanced operational and monitoring capabilities as well as real-time Navigation data. This system will reduce workload, provide significant readiness improvement, improve safety and provide cost avoidance.

[P3A - 2 / ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System]: Provides Flight Deck Thermal Management System (FDTMS) on the flight deck to mitigate damage resulting from MV-22 vertical take off/landing (VTOL) flight operations.

[P3A - 3 / ST002 - LSD Ballast Control Console]: Provides upgrades to the existing Ballast Control Consoles (BCS) and replace legacy BCS with a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) based digital, networked system.

Justification.val: The FY 2021 decrease is associated with LSD 42, LSD 50, LSD 52 Modernization no longer occurring and LSD 41 no longer being inducted into Phase Modernization as all associated modernization within this budget line item will no longer occur.

Name.val: 1.5) Information Systems Security Program  (KMI and KW46)
5) ST003 LSD Hull, Mechanical and Electrical Condition System

Name.@footnote: Accounting entry for prior year funds of all other cost elements no longer funded.

ModificationTitle.val: ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System

Title.val: ST002 - LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System

Name.val: 1.1.1) LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System* - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: LSD Flight Deck Thermal Management System*

Description.val: The Flight Deck Thermal Management System (FDTMS) (SCD 16657) Procures and installs heat mitigating, two layer, composite panels that provides heat protection to the helicopter deck to mitigate damage resulting from MV-22 vertical take off/landing (VTOL) flight operations.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: BALLAST CONTROL CONSOLE UPGRADE*

Description.val: SCD 10828 - Ballast Control Console (BCS) - Provides upgrades to the existing Ballast Control Consoles (BCS) and replaces legacy BCS with a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) based digital, networked system.  This mission and safety critical SCD addresses system degradation due to obsolescence issues, extensive downtime and reduced system capability/reliability. The system is currently operating in a degraded capacity and requires immediate replacement.
